description: Rear roof extension; rear roof outrigger extension; installation of three rooflights to front roofslope
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: A100 Site Location Plan; 576-PL-J-A101 Existing Drawings; 576-PL-J-A102 Proposed First Floor Plan; 576-PL-J-A103 Proposed Loft Plan; 576-PL-J-A104 Proposed Elevations; 576-PL-J-A105 Proposed Sections; 576-PL-J-A106 Proposed 3D; 576-PL-J-A110 Existing And Proposed Front Elevations and 3D Views
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings. The window to be created in the second floor facing towards no.6 Elthorne Avenue shall be obscure glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window is more than 1.7m taken from internal finished floor level.  The window shall thereafter be permanently retained in this condition.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
